title: Baked Onions
introduction: Baked onions, or Cipolle al Forno, is a delightful dish where onions turn smooth and sweet when cooked. Perfectly paired with roast beef, these onions are topped with a savory mixture of bread crumbs, cheese, and olive oil and baked until tender and golden.
ingredients: 4 medium white or red onions, peeled
1/4 cup freshly grated Parmigiano-Reggiano or Pecorino Romano
Salt and freshly ground black pepper
instructions: Bring a medium saucepan of water to a boil. Add the onions and reduce the heat so that the water just simmers. Cook for 5 minutes. Let the onions cool in the water in the pan. Drain the onions and cut them in half crosswise.

Place a rack in the center of the oven. Preheat the oven to 350Â°F. Oil a baking pan just large enough to hold the onions in a single layer. Place the onions in the pan cut-side up. In a small bowl, mix together the bread crumbs, cheese, olive oil, and salt and pepper to taste. Spoon the bread crumbs on top of the onions.
Bake for 1 hour or until the onions are golden and tender when pierced with a knife. Serve hot or at room temperature.
